TSXlSzU74bkJIk8Av.notes: This non-volitional AI is also incapable of self-improvement. It might seem to learn by storing and remembering data, but it cannot assimilate information and use that knowledge in new ways. It requires computer hardware and software with a Complexity equal to or greater than its IQ/2 + 1, rounded up.
TSXlSzU74bkJIk8Av.name: Meta-Trait: Weak Dedicated AI

TWSLDJ_TyDC-nd7Qf.name: Meta-Trait: Volitional AI
TWSLDJ_TyDC-nd7Qf.notes: This sentient program has as much self-initiative and creativity as a living creature of equivalent intelligence. It requires computer hardware and software with a Complexity equal to or greater than its (IQ/2)+3, rounded up.

TcVWJMr3-UL-J4v3e.name: Meta-Trait: Non-Volitional AI
TcVWJMr3-UL-J4v3e.notes: This program lacks self-direction, initiative, creativity, and empathy. It ignores orders from anyone but its master. It requires computer hardware and software with a Complexity equal to or greater than its (IQ/2)+2, rounded up.

TS8jKI6cy8clbP9ys.notes: This digital intelligence simulates the functioning of a living brain. Some mind emulations may be sapient copies or “uploads” of human minds – see Uploading (pp. 219-220). It requires computer hardware and software with a Complexity equal to or greater than its (IQ+5)/2, rounded up.
TS8jKI6cy8clbP9ys.name: Meta-Trait: Mind Emulation

tig8yMJDfN5qCnwe5.name: Enhanced Time Sense
tig8yMJDfN5qCnwe5.notes: You immediately act in combat before those without Enhanced Time Sense; Never freeze; +6 on all IQ rolls to wake up or to recover from surprise or mental stun; Your side gets +1 to initiative rolls (+2 if you're the leader)

Tu23_qHh31wbxSfEc.notes: A living brain is housed inside the machine. The robot template’s computer is reduced one size to make room. See Total Cyborg Brain Transplants (p. 219) for the size of brain case that the machine can hold.
Tu23_qHh31wbxSfEc.name: Meta-Trait: Cyborg Brain

tsNo98xORAEf08f8N.name: Claws, Sharp (Hands)
tsNo98xORAEf08f8N.notes: Only pay for hands or feet, not both

mia4iX91h7r6lFNuY.name: Tough Skin
mia4iX91h7r6lFNuY.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR

mCco1F6k7KH_coy7J.name: Tough Skin
mCco1F6k7KH_coy7J.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR

m2-rExATu-1LXhZhy.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR
m2-rExATu-1LXhZhy.name: Tough Skin

m9jL92Js2PkJVIBMV.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR
m9jL92Js2PkJVIBMV.name: Tough Skin

TP4Wf2d7kJqYJ7UMV.notes: Radical procedure (major at TL10-12). $20,000. LC3. If the subject already has bioplastic skin (p. 212), this is a minor procedure.
TP4Wf2d7kJqYJ7UMV.name: Memory Flesh (TL9)

mFmTK3D52HdSuieYn.name: Temporary Disadvantage, Electrical and No Depth Perception

mFidB5BzQqgD6IxuU.name: Temporary Disadvantage, Electrical and No Depth Perception

tp3PU-zIqLTFhaG0h.name: Blindness
tp3PU-zIqLTFhaG0h.notes: -6 to all combat skills; cannot target hit locations

TCmGlFiLuYe_ln7UI.notes: Two major procedures (minor if replacing existing bionic eyes). $8,000. LC4.
TCmGlFiLuYe_ln7UI.name: Thermal Imaging Eyes (TL10)

mHqEsfOfNyOA2pqKJ.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR
mHqEsfOfNyOA2pqKJ.name: Tough Skin

mlNLBJxbvgkf3aBXa.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR
mlNLBJxbvgkf3aBXa.name: Tough Skin

mDNvL9rg5O0iAmwk6.name: Tough Skin
mDNvL9rg5O0iAmwk6.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR

mL_xHC6pl7jO7nme_.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR
mL_xHC6pl7jO7nme_.name: Tough Skin

TEcXw_AGqTcn3OAbr.name: Heavy Weapon Arm (TL9)
TEcXw_AGqTcn3OAbr.notes: Minor procedure. $100/lb. of weapon weight. LC of weapon.

mnuY49P_Kr-53SpTA.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR
mnuY49P_Kr-53SpTA.name: Tough Skin

m3CMgFGici1h7qvlX.name: Tough Skin
m3CMgFGici1h7qvlX.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR

TFz8wvZ5KBBzusYxc.notes: Two major procedures (minor if replacing existing bionic eyes). $12,000. LC4.
TFz8wvZ5KBBzusYxc.name: Hyperspectral Eyes (TL11)

ThEDA7VJhBD8WD4bG.name: Bionic Arm or Hand Mount (TL9)
ThEDA7VJhBD8WD4bG.notes: Minor procedure. $100/lb. of weapon weight. LC of weapon.

TYgG_dff5xC6wBXC-.notes: Longer and tougher, with a reinforced scalp to support the hair’s capabilities.
TYgG_dff5xC6wBXC-.name: Knee-Length Cyberhair (TL10)

TNcLKMbvXNrFxKePj.notes: Simple procedure. Use the cost and LC of a smart grenade (p. 146); a 25mm or 40mm can fit in the torso, a 15mm in a limb, 10mm elsewhere in the body.
TNcLKMbvXNrFxKePj.name: Bomb Implant (TL9)

T1bSDahmRz_3v4WhE.notes: Simple procedure. $500. No operation required if purchased with the limb. LC4.
T1bSDahmRz_3v4WhE.name: Hidden Compartments (TL9)

tD5EldNbgGqqxDDkx.name: Mind Reading
tD5EldNbgGqqxDDkx.notes: Works the same way as the identical limitation for Possession (p. B76).

tZ6VJHseGk1h1p1zV.name: No fatigue points, Don't spend fatigue points

tzw9FQEzmyuEBhUQ9.name: Eight-hour energy reserve, Refuel 3 times per day

t2Zv9ozEQ_jps8GRW.name: Taboo Trait (Fixed ST, DX, HT, HP)

TkoF4OjPbDuGT152Z.notes: Remove the Sensory Only limitation on Mind Reading. This can be combined with Puppeteer. +$10,000. LC3.
TkoF4OjPbDuGT152Z.name: Mind Interface

TeDLhsj0a8IuWS7mP.name: Computer Implant Template
TeDLhsj0a8IuWS7mP.notes: Major procedure (minor at TL10-12). $4,000 plus the cost of a tiny computer (p. 22) and AI software (p. 25) or a mind emulation (pp. 26, 220) program. LC4.

TormoepiG_m9LMYLX.notes: Major procedure (minor at TL10-12). Cost is $5,000 per slot plus $3,000 per point of abilities that a chip can hold. LC3.
TormoepiG_m9LMYLX.name: Chip Slots (TL9)

TBP5Osf-6uIgTGwiy.notes: Major procedure (minor at TL10-12). $4,500. A/1 year. LC3.
TBP5Osf-6uIgTGwiy.name: Wireless Sensie Transceiver (TL9)

tecUbRZ3245CIouWP.name: Enhanced Time Sense
tecUbRZ3245CIouWP.notes: You immediately act in combat before those without Enhanced Time Sense; Never freeze; +6 on all IQ rolls to wake up or to recover from surprise or mental stun; Your side gets +1 to initiative rolls (+2 if you're the leader)

T9OeHR0z9LuJeuN1g.name: Cognitive Enhancement (TL10)
T9OeHR0z9LuJeuN1g.notes: The maximum points available per operation are 15 at TL10, 45 at TL11, and 60 at TL12. Major procedure. $5,000 × point cost (before applying Temporary Disadvantage). LC3.

TR9pxShU1fe06LzBz.name: Computer Implant (TL9)
TR9pxShU1fe06LzBz.notes: Major procedure (minor at TL10-12). $4,000 + the cost of a tiny computer (p. 22) with the compact option. LC4.

TObPyRI7BNzd6JDZB.notes: This may count as the Involuntary form of Duty (p. B133) if someone else holds the access codes. Radical procedure (TL9), or major proce- dure (TL10-12). $45,000. LC2.
TObPyRI7BNzd6JDZB.name: Puppet Implant (TL9)

TpC6psvbqVZDaUYD9.name: Backup Brain (TL11)
TpC6psvbqVZDaUYD9.notes: Once the implant has taken over, the user’s ability to avoid IQ losses from aging and sometimes evade death is the Extra Life (Copy) advantage. Radical procedure. $25,000. LC3.

TGeJQ-0UADI7ayov6.notes: A disadvantage granted by a psych implant will have the (Temporary Disadvantage, Electrical, -20%) limitation. A disadvantage that is negated by a psych implant will have the (Mitigator, -70%) limitation. A persona map of the patient is required; see Brainscanner (p. 203). This data is used to program the implant. Major procedure (minor at TL10-12). $1,000 per -1 point of disadvantage added or mitigated. LC3.
TGeJQ-0UADI7ayov6.name: Psych Implant (TL9)

TS9N_qopREoCvYgFt.name: Neurotherapy Implant (TL9)
TS9N_qopREoCvYgFt.notes: Add the Mitigator (-70%) limitation for the disadvantage. A persona map of the patient is required before a neurotherapy implant can be installed; see Brainscanner (p. 203). This data is used to program the implant. Major procedure (minor at TL10-12). $500 per -1 point of disadvantage. LC3.

tWpvBeYzwbHTeIbSt.name: This replaces Wild Animal or Domestic Animal [-30]

T8rSReRLeiRc0Ht0R.name: Neural Uplift (TL9)
T8rSReRLeiRc0Ht0R.notes: Radical procedure (major at TL10-12). Reduce difficulty of the procedure by one step (e.g., major to minor) if performed on an animal with a racial IQ 1-3. $5,000 × average racial IQ before the cybernetic uplift operation. LC3.

TK1r2KwDbBNjidrGm.name: Finger Paws (TL9)
TK1r2KwDbBNjidrGm.notes: Two major operations (minor at TL11-12). $10,000. LC3.

TOuHIK4-qxEoxaS7v.name: Total cyborg brain transplants
TOuHIK4-qxEoxaS7v.notes: Radical operation (major at TL10-12). $40,000 for the brain case, plus the cost of robot body. The cyborg’s body is functional after the operation.

tXdgHlNWHkWgMChvN.name: The character takes on the robot body’s racial template with the Cyborg lens; his brain is the same. See Mind Transfer (p. B296).
